service.description: DC/OS Beakerx comes with a handful of pre-installed packages for data scientists. Since BeakerX 0.15.2 there is also GPU support included. Pre-Installed packages include: H5PY 2.7.1, Keras 2.1.5, Numpy 1.14.2, Pandas 0.22.0, PySpark 2.3.0, Scikit-Learn 0.19.1, Tensorflow & Tensorboard 1.7.0, XLRD 1.1.0

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each service instance.

gpu_support.description:
GPU support and useful packages for Data Scientists.

Additional packages installed:
CUDA 9.0.176, CUDNN 7.1.3.16, Tensorflow-GPU 1.7.0

enable.description:
Enable GPU support.
Note: This requires at least 15GB disk space available with recent NVIDIA drivers installed.

mount_agent_libraries.description:
Enable native support of Spark 2.2.1 in your DC/OS cluster.
Note: Jupyter will run under root and the container has access to /opt/mesosphere to utilize your agents libraries.

gpus.description:
GPU shares to allocate to your Beakerx package.
Note: GPU support has to be enabled.

mem.description: Memory to allocate to each service instance.

port_api.description: Port number to be used for api communication internally to the cluster.

external_access.description:
Enable access from outside the cluster through Marathon-LB.
NOTE: this connection is unencrypted.

enable.description: Enable or disable creating a VIP for external access through a public node running Marathon-LB.

external_public_agent_ip.description: For external access, dns to be used for Marathon-LB vHost: For example use your public slave elb dns.

external_access_port.description: For external access, port number to be used for clear communication in the external Marathon-LB load balancer
